snippet: The courts did the right thing by blocking voter ID laws in Texas and Wisconsin that aim to keep people from the polls.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Justice Department's forceful rejection of a Texas voter-identification law that would have disenfranchised as many as 800,000 Hispanic voters in the state; also praises ruling by Wisconsin Judge Richard Niess, who held that the state's voter-ID law violates the state constitution; argues that both challenges are important steps toward restoring a basic constitutional right to those who have lost it.
lead_paragraph: The courts did the right thing by blocking voter ID laws in Texas and Wisconsin that aim to keep people from the polls.
